{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question states that the patient's pupil did not constrict after the administration of 1% Pilocarpine. According to Document [1], if non-dilute pilocarpine fails to constrict the pupil, then the pupil is pharmacologically dilated. This suggests that the pupil has been dilated by a drug and is not responding to the pilocarpine due to this pharmacological blockade.", "answer_choice": "C. Pharmacological blockade"}
